result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Wayne Brown

records.addlTxt: 10:47 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Timothy Wayne Brown not in court. Set for STC. Court reviews file, notes returned mail for Notice of Hearing for today's date. ADA Becker states that an offer was extended to DE, has not received verification that DE has completed class. State requests amendment and default. Court amends Ct 1 to County Ordinance 52- Disorderly Conduct. Court defaults DE and orders fine $295. Court leaves case open for 60 days to allow DE to respond due to his non-appearance today. Adjourned: 10:50 AM. kma
NOH (STC) returned by PO. Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward. olg
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 10:45 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kimberly S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:41 PM CO: SJN, RPR: B. Berhow, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker and Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF:  Timothy Wayne Brown appeared. DE does not qualify for public defender. DE states that he wishes to represent himself to settle case. Atty. Harrelson states that there is an offer to an ordinance resolution. DE wishes to conclude this case today as he is moving to Iowa. Court sets 60-day internal review for stipulation with amended charges. DE to complete anger management coursework. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. Court sets bond. Adjourned: 1:50 PM. kma
